intro: Lepidaploa lilacina, commonly known as the pink-flowered rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and conservation areas.
